reviewBody: This book is a slog. Dense writing and heavy on details. I got lost in the jargon and struggled to finish it.
Great resource for anyone interested in medieval thought. Well-organized and provides a good overview of the major figures and ideas. Would have liked more analysis though.
If you're looking for a light read, this ain't it. But if you're up for a challenge and want to delve deep into medieval ideas, this book is worth the effort.
Disappointed. The book promised to bridge God and reason, but it felt more focused on theology. Not what I was expecting.
Wow! Opened my eyes to a whole new world of intellectual history. Makes you appreciate the complexity of medieval thought. A must-read for scholars and curious minds alike.
This book feels dated. The arguments seem repetitive, and the author could have used some fresh perspectives. Needs an update.
Great book for those new to medieval philosophy. Explains the key concepts in a clear and concise way. Would benefit from including some primary sources though.
Dense but rewarding read. Grant masterfully weaves together philosophy, theology, and history. Not for the faint of heart, but a true gem for those who persevere.
Dense but rewarding read. Grant masterfully weaves together philosophy, theology, and history. Not for the faint of heart, but a true gem for those who persevere.
This book is a fantastic exploration of how history can be manipulated and misused. A must-read for anyone interested in critical thinking and understanding the past.
Disappointed. The book felt repetitive and lacked new insights. Expected a more in-depth analysis of historical manipulation.
The book covers important topics, but the writing style felt dry at times.  Could benefit from more engaging examples.
An eye-opening read! This book challenges readers to critically evaluate historical narratives and exposes the dangers of historical manipulation. Highly recommend!

Scenes from Deep Time is a wonderful exploration of how scientists reconstruct prehistoric environments and creatures. The book delves into the artistic process while explaining the scientific reasoning behind the reconstructions. It sparked my curiosity to learn more about paleontology. Highly recommend it for anyone interested in dinosaurs, natural history, or the intersection of art and science!
Disappointed by the lack of scientific detail. The reconstructions felt more like artistic interpretations than based on actual evidence.
Beautiful visuals! A great coffee table book.
The illustrations in Scenes from Deep Time are impressive, but the accompanying text felt a little basic. Might be more suited for younger readers or those new to paleontology.

Scenes from Deep Time is a fascinating journey through our planet's ancient past. The reconstructions bring prehistoric worlds to life, making them both educational and captivating. A great read for anyone curious about dinosaurs and beyond!
